definition: lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
free reed wind instrument similar to the sheng 笙[sheng1], used in ancient China
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.chinese: 他是個濫竽充數的演員。

sentences.english: You can also hear people saying it about themselves to show their modesty.
sentences.chinese: 人們有時也用“濫竽充數”來表示自謙。

sentences.english: He is a poor apology for an actor.
sentences.chinese: 他是個濫竽充數的演員。

sentences.english: Am I just making up numbers?
Are you just making up numbers?
He is a poor apology for a researcher of the American drama.
sentences.chinese: 他不過是一名濫竽充數的美國戲劇研究者。

definition: lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
